meanings.definition: A line or fold in fabric before it is creased.
meanings.sent1: She carefully smoothed out the precrease in the fabric before ironing.
meanings.sent2: The tailor marked the precrease on the cloth before cutting it.
meanings.sent3: The precrease in the dress made it look like a paper fan.
meanings.sent4: The precrease in the map guided them on their journey.
meanings.sent5: The precrease in the paper made it easier to fold.

meanings.definition: To fold or crease something before the final crease is made.
meanings.sent1: He decided to precrease the paper before making the origami crane.
meanings.sent2: She gently precreased the letter before sealing it in the envelope.
meanings.sent3: The chef precreased the dough before shaping the croissants.
meanings.sent4: The artist precreased the canvas before starting the painting.
meanings.sent5: Precreasing the napkin added an elegant touch to the table setting.
